data.title: Norway at the 1900 Summer Olympics

Summer Olympics appearances (overview)Other related appearances1906 Intercalated Games

Norway competed at the Summer Olympic Games for the first time at the 1900 Summer Olympics in Paris. Results from Norwegian athletes are typically considered separate from those of Swedish competitors despite the Union between Sweden and Norway that existed in 1900, as these were two separate kingdoms in a personal union under one king.

Norway finished in 16th position in the final medal rankings with 5 medals.

Medal Name Sport Event Date [1] Shooting 300 metre free rifle, standing August 5 [2] Shooting 300 metre free rifle, team August 5 [3] Athletics pole vault July 15 [4] Shooting 300 metre free rifle, prone August 5 [5] Shooting 300 metre free rifle, three positions August 5

Two Norwegian athletes, a runner and a jumper, competed in four athletics events, winning one bronze medal in the pole vault.

Athlete Event Heat Final Result Rank Result Rank Yngvar Bryn 200 m Unknown 3 did not advance 400 m Unknown 5 did not advance

Athlete Event Final Result Rank Carl Albert Andersen High jump 1.70 4 Pole vault 3.20 [3]
